answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some links that may be a helpful start to your research.
Harpswell, ME recently spent money to improve their CATV system. You may want to contact them directly for more information on what type of updates they made.
http://www.theforecaster.net/news/print/2012/02/16/harpswell-gauge-support-spending-boat-launches-cat/114305 
Last year West Hartford, CT made improvements to their community television channel.
http://www.hfpg.org/WhatsNew/News/NewsArticle/ArticleId/287/West-Hartford-Community-Television-Upgrades-Technology.aspx 
Also, in Middlebury, VT they approved a two-year plan to help overhaul their CATV channel.
http://middleburycommunitytv.org/accessplan 
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Marcia Schirdewahn
text: We need to upgrade the community bulletin board on our local government access cable TV station.  We have some information on Leightronix.  We are looking for more providers, reviews of products, and hopefully someone with newer equipment/software in the Chicagoland area that we could actually visit on site.
title: digital video messaging
